intro: Soromanes dentata, commonly known as the toothed soromanes, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its serrated leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
